intro: Ponthieva racemosa var. brittoniae, commonly known as the Britton's ponthieva, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Arecaceae family, commonly known as the palm family. The plant features a slender, unbranched stem with a single, fan-shaped crown of leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in racemes, typically appearing at the base of the plant. The varietal form, brittoniae, is distinguished by its unique leaf shape and floral characteristics compared to the typical variety.
